resources.string: An urn contains an even number of balls; half of the balls in the urn are white and the other half black. If three balls are drawn at the same time from the urn, the probability of drawing 3 balls of the same color is 20%. How many balls are there in the urn before any balls are drawn?

Maths 101 is a game about showing different uses of maths in real life situations. Start playing by selecting a level and a subject you want to test your knowledge on. You can later prove your skills by applying your knowledge into real life situations by pressing the \"Real Life Situations\" under the level of your choice.\n\nNote: This game requires you to have at least studied some basics of the question you\'re answering as it doesn't go through basic methods. Please round your answers to the 2 decimal places
